meanings.definition: To cry or scream loudly and harshly.
meanings.sent1: The baby was squalling all night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent2: The monkeys in the zoo were squalling loudly, disturbing the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started squalling in the middle of the movie, adding an unexpected soundtrack.
meanings.sent4: The wind outside sounded like a squalling banshee, sending shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: Her squalling voice echoed through the empty hallway, full of raw emotion.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or scream.
meanings.sent1: The squalling of the seagulls filled the air at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The squalling of the injured cat could be heard from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The squalling of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly from my dream.
meanings.sent4: The squalling of the wind through the trees sounded like a haunted melody.
meanings.sent5: The squalling of the storm outside made it hard to concentrate on my book.
